Name: treatment of heat carrier liquid, 40% C3H8O2, wastewater treatment | heat carrier liquid, 40% C3H8O2 | EN15804GD, U
Category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/37:Sewerage/370:Sewerage/3700:Sewerage
Description: This activity represents the treatment of a specific wastewater in a WWT plant (while direct emissions and sewering are heeded in the upstream market dataset for this wastewater). The size of the treatment plant infrastructure is for a national average territory situation. The assumed size of the WWTP treats 90.6 Mio m3 per year. The mixture of WWTP with one, two, or three stages is 0%-11.2%-88.8%. The actual, waste-specific oxygen requirement in the biological stages is 169.4kg O. The generated waste-specific raw sludge mass (dry matter) is 255.4kg DM. 89% of the raw sludge (DM) is treated with anaerobic digestion. The digestion process produces 163300 litres of biogas with an energy content of 3781MJ. 23.6% of the biogas is utilized for energy. The remainder is flared. The gross electric efficiency is 26.564%. The gross thermal efficiency is 47.853%. After digestion, the remaining total sludge mass (dry matter) is 133.9kg DM.
